page.title: 04Ferry Lane
page.content: Ferry Lane starts at the Stones Arms public house on the High Street in Skellingthorpe village, and ends at the Fossdyke. It is approximately one and a half km long and runs eastwards. It is called Ferry Lane because there used to be a ferry at the end to cross the canal but this is no longer the case. Most of the land on either side of Ferry Lane is agricultural where potatoes, corn and sugar beet is grown. There is also a pig farm and a field in which there are sheep and a donkey. Also along the lane is a sewerage works and a slaughter house.
